Python LRMS backends

Module tree >¶

lrms
|– fork
|– lsf
|– slurm
|– common
|– cancel
|– common
|– config
|– files
|– parse
|– proc
|– scan
|– submit
|– tools


The lrms package >¶

Modules for each LRMS.

The lrms.fork module¶

Functions for fork job handling.

lrms.fork.set_fork(cfg)[source]¶

Fill Config with fork-specific options.

Parameters:cfg (ConfigParser.ConfigParser) – parsed config (from get_parsed_config())
lrms.fork.Submit(config, jobdescs, jc)[source]¶

Submit a fork job.

Parameters:
  • config (str) – path to arc.conf
  • jobdescs (arc.JobDescriptionList (Swig Object of type 'Arc::JobDescriptionList *')) – job description list object
  • jc (arc.compute.JobContainer (Swig Object of type Arc::EntityContainer< Arc::Job > *')) – job container object
Returns:

True if successfully submitted, else False
Return type:

bool
lrms.fork.get_job_script(jobdescs)[source]¶

Get the complete bash job script.

Parameters:jobdescs – list of job description objects
Returns:job script
Return type:str
lrms.fork.Cancel(grami_file)[source]¶

Cancel a fork job.

Parameters:grami_file (str) – path to grami file
Returns:True if successfully cancelled, else False
Return type:bool
lrms.fork.Scan(config, ctr_dirs)[source]¶

Scan and update status of fork jobs.

Parameters:
  • config (str) – path to arc.conf
  • ctr_dirs (list [ str ... ]) – list of paths to control directories
lrms.fork.process_jobs(jobs)[source]¶

Check if jobs are still running. If job is finished, get the exit code, update the lrms_done_file and write to the comments_file.

Parameters:job (list [ Object ... ]) – list of job objects (from get_jobs())

Parameters:job (list [ Object ... ]) – list of job objects (from get_jobs())
class lrms.slurm.JobDescriptionParserSLURM[source]¶

SLURM v2.4 sbatch options not supported: –acctg-freq=<seconds> -B –extra-node-info=<sockets[:cores[:threads]]> –begin=<time> –checkpoint=<time> –checkpoint-dir=<directory> –comment=<string> -C, –constraint=<list> –contiguous –cores-per-socket=<cores> –cpu_bind=[{quiet,verbose},]type -d, –dependency=<dependency_list> -D, –workdir=<directory> –export=<environment variables | ALL | NONE> –export-file=<filename | fd> -F, –nodefile=<node file> –gid=<group> –gres=<list> -H, –hold -h, –help –hint=<type> -I, –immediate -i, –input=<filename pattern> –jobid=<jobid> -k, –no-kill -L, –licenses=<license> -M, –clusters=<string> -m, –distribution= –mail-type=<type> –mail-user=<user> –mem=<MB> –mem-per-cpu=<MB> –mem_bind=[{quiet,verbose},]type –mincpus=<n> -N, –nodes=<minnodes[-maxnodes]> –network=<type> –nice[=adjustment] -c, –cpus-per-task=<ncpus> –ntasks-per-core=<ntasks> –ntasks-per-socket=<ntasks> –ntasks-per-node=<ntasks> -O, –overcommit –open-mode=append|truncate –propagate[=rlimits] -Q, –quiet –qos=<qos> –requeue –reservation=<name> -s, –share –signal=<sig_num>[@<sig_time>] –sockets-per-node=<sockets> –switches=<count>[@<max-time>] –tasks-per-node=<n> –threads-per-core=<threads> –time-min=<time> –tmp=<MB> -u, –usage –uid=<user> -V, –version -v, –verbose -w, –nodelist=<node name list> –wait-all-nodes=<value> –wckey=<wckey> –wrap=<command string> -x, –exclude=<node name list> –blrts-image=<path> –cnload-image=<path> –conn-type=<type> -g, –geometry=<XxYxZ> –ioload-image=<path> –linux-image=<path> –mloader-image=<path> -R, –no-rotate –ramdisk-image=<path> –reboot



The lrms.common package >¶

Common classes, functions and objects for all LRMSs.

The lrms.common.cancel module¶

Common job cancel functions.

lrms.common.cancel.cancel(cmd, job_id, lrms, remote=False)[source]¶

Cancel job (applicable for all LRMSs except fork and boinc).

Parameters:
  • cmd (str) – cancel command (e.g. ‘/usr/bin/scancel’)
  • job_id (str) – job ID within the LRMS
  • lrms (str) – name of the LRMS
  • remote (str) – True if remote host
Returns:

command return code
Return type:

int
lrms.common.cancel.get_status_file(ctrdir, gridid)[source]¶

Get the job status file (for fork and boinc).

Parameters:
  • ctrdir (str) – path to GRID control directory
  • gridid (str) – GRID (global) job ID
Returns:

path to job status file
Return type:

str


The lrms.common.common module¶

Declares the ArcError exception and Config, UserConfig and Logger objects.

Generic empty object.

exception lrms.common.common.ArcError(msg, caller=None)[source]¶

Print an Arc::ERROR to the log and exit.

Parameters:msg (str) – an informative error message

Object object holding arc.conf options

lrms.common.common.Logger¶

The lrms.common.files module¶

Functions for reading and writing files.

lrms.common.files.read(path, tail=0)[source]¶

Read content from file.

Parameters:
  • path (str) – path to file
  • tail (int) – number of lines to read (from end), entire file if 0
Returns:

True and the file content (:py:meth:file.readlines()) if read was successful, else False and an error message
Return type:

tuple ( bool, [ str ... ] )
lrms.common.files.write(path, buf, mode=420, append=False, remote_host=None)[source]¶

Write buffer to file.

Parameters:
  • path (str) – path to file
  • buf (str) – string buffer to be written
  • mode (int) – file mode
  • append (bool) – True if buffer should be appended to existing file
  • remote_host (bool) – file will be opened with sftp at the specified hostname
lrms.common.files.getmtime(path)[source]¶

Get modification time of a file.

Parameters:path (str) – path to file
Return str:modification time


The lrms.common.parse module¶

Classes for parsing GRAMI files.

class lrms.common.parse.SimpleGramiParser(grami)[source]¶

Read grami file and set each option as a class attribute.

Parameters:grami (str) – path to grami file
jobid¶

Get local ID from grami or job local file.

Returns:local ID
Return type:str
gridid¶

Get GRID (global) job ID from grami.

Returns:GRID job ID
Return type:str
controldir¶

Get control directory from grami.

Returns:control directory
Return type:str
arg_code¶

Get expected exit code from grami.

Returns:arg code
Return type:int
class lrms.common.parse.RTE0EnvCreator(jobdesc, config, mappingUpdate={})[source]¶
class lrms.common.parse.JobDescriptionParserGRAMi[source]¶


The lrms.common.proc module¶

Classes for executing commands locally or via SSH.

lrms.common.proc.execute_local(args, env={})[source]¶

Execute a command locally using subprocess.Popen with shell=True.

Parameters:
  • args (str) – command with arguments (e.g. ‘sbatch myjob.sh’)
  • env (dict) – environment variables (default: {})
Returns:

handle object
Return type:

subprocess.Popen
Note:

wait() is called, and stdout and stderr is read.
lrms.common.proc.execute_remote(args, host=None, timeout=10)[source]¶

Execute a command on the remote host using the SSH protocol.

Parameters:args (str) – command with arguments (e.g. ‘sbatch myjob.sh’)
Returns:object with attributes stdout, stderr and returncode
Return type:Object


The lrms.common.scan module¶

Common job scanning functions and constants.

lrms.common.scan.get_jobs(ctrdirs)[source]¶

Get GRID jobs with status INLRMS.

Parameters:ctrdirs (list) – list of paths (str) to controld directories
Returns:dictionary of local job IDs and job objects
Return type:dict { str : Object }

Note

The job obects have the following attributes: localid, gridid, local_file, lrms_done_file, grami_file, output_file, state, uid, gid, sessiondir, diag_file, count_file, errors_file and comments_file. The file and dir attributes are paths (str), while state (str) is the current state of the job within the LRMS.

lrms.common.scan.set_exit_code_from_diag(job)[source]¶

Retrieve exit code from the diag file. If successful, the exit code will be saved in job.exitcode.

Parameters:job (Object) – job object (from get_jobs())
Returns:True if exit code was found, else False
Return type:bool
lrms.common.scan.update_diag(job)[source]¶

Filters out WallTime from the .diag-file if present and replaces it with output from the LRMS. It also adds StartTime and EndTime for accounting.

Parameters:job (Object) – job object (from get_jobs())
lrms.common.scan.read_local_file(job)[source]¶

Read local_file and set localid and sessiondir attributes of job object.

Parameters:job (Object) – job object with attributes controldir and globalid
Returns:True if successful, else False
Return type:bool
lrms.common.scan.gm_kick(jobs)[source]¶

Execute gm-kick.

Parameters:job (list [ Object ]) – list of jobs (from get_jobs()) to be kicked
lrms.common.scan.write_comments(job)[source]¶

Write content of comments file to errors file.

Parameters:job (Object) – job object (from get_jobs())
lrms.common.scan.get_MDS(dm, lc_time=None)[source]¶

Get date and time in MDS format.

Parameters:dm – dictionary with keys ‘yyyy’, ‘mm’|’bbb’,

‘dd’, ‘HH’, ‘MM’ and ‘SS’ :type dm: dict :return: string on the form ‘yyyy-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS’ :rtype: str

lrms.common.scan.is_running(pid)[source]¶

Check if a process is running.

Parameters:pid (int) – process ID
Returns:True if process is running, else False
Return type:bool
lrms.common.scan.RUNNING¶

list of possible states (str) for running jobs

lrms.common.scan.UID¶

user ID (int)

lrms.common.scan.UID

group ID (int)

lrms.common.scan.MESSAGES¶

mapping between job states and job messages (dict { str : str })

The lrms.common.tools module¶

Tools and helper functions.

lrms.common.tools.lremove(string, prefix)[source]¶

Remove sub-string from beginning of string.

Parameters:
  • string (str) – string to be edited
  • prefix (str) – remove this from beginning of string if exact match
Returns:

string (without prefix if exact match)
Return type:

str
lrms.common.tools.rremove(string, suffix)[source]¶

Remove sub-string from end of string.

Parameters:
  • string (str) – string to be edited
  • sufffix (str) – remove this from end of string if exact match
Returns:

string (without suffix if exact match)
Return type:

str
lrms.common.tools.tail(path, n, BUFSIZ=4096)[source]¶

Similar to GNU tail -n [N].

Parameters:
  • path (str) – path to file
  • n (int) – number of lines to read
  • BUFSIZ (int) – chunk size in bytes (default: 4096)
